header.title: Post-Modern Magick
header.category: Western Esotericism, Occultism, Magic, Chaos Magic, Hermeticism

central_thesis: The central thesis is that 'post-modern magick' is an eclectic, deconstructionist, and individually relevant non-system for reality shaping. It draws foundational principles from Hermeticism and perennial philosophy but actively encourages practitioners to transcend rigid dogma. The book advocates for the creation and adaptation of personal paradigms and spells through informed questioning, continuous innovation, and the focused application of 'Magical Will,' ultimately leading to a 'New Aeon' of spiritual freedom and evolving societal structures.

structure_content.chapter_title: LIBER I: Introduction to Post-Modern Magick
structure_content.summary: This section introduces the core philosophy, defining Magick as reality shaping through occult processes and outlining post-modern magick as an eclectic, deconstructionist, and individually relevant non-system. It establishes four 'General Perennial Principles of Magic' (all energy is potential magical, will elicits change, belief affects ability, power depends on focus). It distinguishes 'Magical Will' from personal will, presents 'Free Form Magick' as a flexible, personally relevant approach, and provides a concise introduction to Hermeticism. Key operational concepts like 'The Logris' (a spell-staging and amplification energy field) and 'The Astral' (various levels of reality for exploration) are detailed.

This liber presents a collection of practical spells categorized into Formulaic, Spontaneous, and Ritual magick, each with specific components and effects. Spells cover a range of magical operations, including 'Zen Navigation' (for finding targets), 'Alacrity' (physical speed), 'The Old Straight Track' (divination/power from ley lines), 'Alarm' (magical security), 'Manifest Reality' (gradual reality alteration), 'Affect Lifeline' (vitality manipulation), 'Dreamscape' (entering/controlling dreams), 'Conceal' (invisibility), 'Ghost in the Machine' (altering devices), 'Machine Empathy' (rapport with machines), 'Mantle' (defensive energy field), 'Nullify' (absorbing/redirecting magical energy), 'Summons' (forcing entity presence), 'Ruin' (rapid aging of objects), and 'Silent Ambush' (mental traps). It also includes 'Epoch,' a detailed script for a ceremonial group working, illustrating the 'Rite of the Passing' and evolution of magical orders through mental combat.

This section introduces different post-modern paradigms, each representing a self-contained belief system and set of practices. The 'Reality Hacker' paradigm conceptualizes reality as 'The Program,' a vast operating system where magicians ('Programmers') 'code' changes to alter the 'Interface' (physical reality), with associated 'Righteous Hacks' like 'ICE' (cyber-security enchantment), 'Hyper-Coding' (trance for faster coding), 'Download Spirit' (summoning/binding entities), and 'Soul Hacking' (implanting behaviors/thoughts). 'The Market' paradigm treats wealth as an energy flow ('golden waters') to be influenced by the 'Principal' (magician), with 'Portfolio' spells like 'Little Black Book,' 'The Pen,' and 'Market Stability/Crash/Projection.' The 'Goth' paradigm focuses on 'Mana' (power of presence/attitude) and eclecticism, with 'The Track List' spells like 'Opening the Eyes of the Sleeping' (heightened perception), 'This is your Life' (induced self-critique), 'Face in the Crowd' (disappearing), 'Bum a Dollar from the Universe' (finding cash), 'It's the Little Things that Kill' (hexes), 'Goth Glamour' (persona crafting), 'Survey the Herd' (social divination), and 'Coffee' (beverage infusion ritual). 'NEW AEON' is a theoretical analog predicting a future of spiritual anarchy and 'Corporate Feudalism'.

structure_content.chapter_title: LIBER IV: Collection of Older Magical Texts
structure_content.summary: This final section serves as a reference and framework for the seeker, providing a list of foundational historical magical texts from which modern magical traditions and practices derive. These include seminal works like The Corpus Hermeticum, The Grimoirium Verum, The Greater & Lesser Keys of Solomon, Theurgia Goetia, and others. It underscores the author's emphasis on understanding the 'roots' of magic as a basis for post-modern innovation and deconstruction.

key_concepts.definition: The process of shaping reality to the will of the user; an occult process. It is distinct from science in its occult nature, requiring initiation and secret knowledge to learn or command.

An eclectic and deconstructionist non-system of reality shaping. It lacks a fundamental structure but relies on individual personal relevance, drawing from Hermeticism while being free from dogma. Its essence is to rediscover, invent, and evolve through informed questioning and adaptation of existing systems.

Four universal principles unifying magical understanding across cultures: 1. All energy is potential magical energy. 2. Magic is the use of will to elicit change in energy towards a desired end. 3. The ability to use magic is directly affected by belief. 4. The power of magic depends upon the focus of the user.

The raw strength exerted by a magus to manipulate magical energy. It is distinct from personal will (ego/personality desires) and is used to gather, shape, control, and send out magical energies. Its effective utilization requires knowledge and skill.

A dynamic symbol of Chaos, also an energy field surrounding the magus that serves as a staging area and amplifier for spells. Spells can be 'hung' on the Logris for later use, gaining an energy boost upon retrieval. With repeated use, it can 'remember' spells and evolve into a 'living grimoire'.

A phrase used loosely to describe the infinite levels of reality and perception, specifically the spiritual reflection of the physical realm. It includes sub-realms such as the infernal, dreamscape, celestial, and faerie, accessible through altered states of consciousness like meditation or lucid dreaming.

A conceptual model where reality (especially the astral plane) is a vast operating system, with magicians as 'Programmers' who use 'coding' (trance-based visualization) to alter 'data clusters' (physical objects) and change the 'Interface' (physical reality). Spells are 'hacks' or innovations within this system.

The magical power derived from personal presence, attitude, and personality within the Goth magick paradigm. It provides social status, influence, and enhances the effectiveness of spells, particularly in social settings or rituals with witnesses.

A theoretical future era characterized by spiritual anarchy, freedom, and evolution, where traditional institutions (religion, empire, commerce) collapse due to entropy. It is predicted to lead to 'Corporate Feudalism,' where corporations become the new 'Empires,' governing societal roles.

practical_system.description: The practical system of Post-Modern Magick is a dynamic, personalized approach to reality shaping, rooted in the four perennial principles of magic (energy, will, belief, focus). It encourages the magus to deconstruct existing traditions and create their own 'Free Form Magick' based on personal relevance and effectiveness. Key operational mechanics include cultivating 'Magical Will' (raw power) and utilizing 'The Logris' (a personal energy field for spell storage and amplification). The system integrates diverse paradigms such as 'The Program' (reality as a computer system), 'The Market' (wealth as energy flow), and 'Goth Magick' (mana-driven personal power), each offering specific conceptual frameworks and corresponding 'hacks' or 'spells.' The practitioner is encouraged to be an innovator, constantly experimenting and evolving their magical practice.

Grimoires (personal records like the 'Little Black Book' for notes, spells, sensitive information)
The Pen (writing stylus, often engraved, used to channel wealth/manifest currency; extendable to other business icons like Palm Pilots, calculators, laptops)
Computer/Technological Devices (for 'coding' spells within 'The Program' paradigm; floppy disks, hard drives, handheld devices as repositories)
Uppers (caffeine, chocolate, orange juice to enhance coding speed during trance states)
Ritual Dagger (symbolic weapon for mental duels)
Wormwood and Water (mixed in a ritual vessel for 'Poisoning the Spirit')
rituals: Formulaic Magick (structured invocations, gestures, foci for channeling and focusing energy)
Spontaneous Magick (words/gestures with summoned energy for quick, temporary effects)
Ritual Magick (complex ceremonies with rare elements for powerful, precise effects)
Epoch (a theatrical ceremonial working for group evolution and leadership succession)
Goth Glamour (ritualistic dressing to empower clothing/accessories for persona creation)
Coffee Ritual (infusing beverages with magical energy or emotions)
Hyper-Coding (trance state via meditation/breathing for extended magical 'coding')
Market Stability/Crash/Projection (meditative visualization to influence global market energy patterns)

relevant_quotes.text: Defining Magick: (Magic is defined as the process of shaping reality to the will of the user of said magic. Whereas the word spell means the tangible result of such use of the will, magic is the process in which the spell is completed. One might argue that science is a process that produces useable data, and therefore is magic. The one difference between magic and any other process, thus the one thing defining it as magic, is the fact that it is an occult process. Everyone knows or has the ability to learn or discover normal or scientific processes, magic by its nature as an occult element of reality, is secret and difficult to learn or command. For the Initiated, meaning those who have delved into the occult realms of reality and have learned those secrets, such a process is an option.)

Post-modern magick is an eclectic and deconstructionist non-system of reality shaping. While there is no fundamental structure or form, an illusory and pragmatic construct must be presented in order to accomplish basic communication in the literary medium.
All energy is potential magical energy.
Magic is the use of will to elicit change in energy towards a desired end.
The ability to use magic is directly affected by belief.
The power of magic depends upon the focus of the user.
"Do what thou wilt shall be the whole of the Law”–Aleister Crowley
Post-modern free form magick is indeed the middle path, with Attitude.

critical_analysis.relevance: This work is highly relevant within Western Esotericism for its bold attempt to synthesize post-modern philosophy with magical practice. It offers a contemporary answer to the rigidity of traditional systems by championing eclecticism, deconstruction, and individual relevance, echoing and expanding upon principles found in Chaos Magic. The integration of modern concepts such as cybernetics ('The Program,' 'Reality Hacker') and socioeconomic theory ('The Market,' 'Corporate Feudalism') provides a unique lens through which to view and apply magic, making it applicable to the challenges and opportunities of the 21st century. It explicitly positions itself as a tool for personal evolution and adaptation, urging practitioners to move beyond dogmatic adherence and foster continuous innovation.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The book is primarily aimed at aspiring magicians and experienced occultists who feel constrained by traditional, dogmatic magical systems. It will appeal to practitioners of Chaos Magic due to its emphasis on deconstruction and personal paradigm creation. Individuals interested in the philosophical underpinnings of magic, particularly those who appreciate eclecticism and a critical approach to established traditions, will find it valuable. Its use of modern analogies and a counter-cultural 'Goth' paradigm also suggests an appeal to younger practitioners or those who identify with alternative subcultures and seek to integrate their spiritual practice with contemporary identity and technology.
